item.title: E-ZPass toll payment texts return in massive phishing wave
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An ongoing phishing campaign impersonating E-ZPass and other toll agencies has surged recently, with recipients receiving multiple iMessage and SMS texts to steal personal and credit card information. [...]

item.title: OpenAI tests watermarking for ChatGPT-4o Image Generation model
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is reportedly testing a new "watermark" for the Image Generation model, which is a part of the ChatGPT 4o model. [...]

item.title: Carding tool abusing WooCommerce API downloaded 34K times on PyPI
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A newly discovered malicious PyPi package named 'disgrasya' that abuses legitimate WooCommerce stores for validating stolen credit cards has been downloaded over 34,000 times from the open-source package platform. [...]

item.title: Coinbase to fix 2FA account activity entry freaking out users
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Coinbase is fixing an incorrect account activity message that freaks out customers and makes them think their credentials were compromised. [...]

item.title: WinRAR flaw bypasses Windows Mark of the Web security alerts
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A vulnerability in the WinRAR file archiver solution could be exploited to bypass the Mark of the Web (MotW) security warning and execute arbitrary code on a Windows machine. [...]

item.title: Port of Seattle says ransomware breach impacts 90,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Port of Seattle, the U.S. government agency overseeing Seattle's seaport and airport, is notifying roughly 90,000 individuals of a data breach after their personal information was stolen in an August 2024 ransomware attack. [...]

item.title: PoisonSeed phishing campaign behind emails with wallet seed phrases
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A large-scale phishing campaign dubbed 'PoisonSeed' compromises corporate email marketing accounts to distribute emails containing crypto seed phrases used to drain cryptocurrency wallets. [...]

item.title: Australian pension funds hit by wave of credential stuffing attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Over the weekend, a massive wave of credential stuffing attacks hit multiple large Australian super funds, compromising thousands of members' accounts. [...]

item.title: Europcar GitLab breach exposes data of up to 200,000 customers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A hacker breached the GitLab repositories of multinational car-rental company Europcar Mobility Group and stole source code for Android and iOS applications, as well as some personal information belonging to up to 200,000 users. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's $20 ChatGPT Plus is now free for students until the end of May
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT Plus subscription is now free, but only if you're a student based out of the United States of America and Canada. [...]

item.title: Max severity RCE flaw discovered in widely used Apache Parquet
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A maximum severity remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been discovered impacting all versions of Apache Parquet up to and including 1.15.0. [...]

item.title: Hunters International shifts from ransomware to pure data extortion
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Hunters International Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation is shutting down and rebranding with plans to switch to data theft and extortion-only attacks. [...]
